googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* For the November 3, 2020 election, every active registered voter will receive an **absentee ballot application** in the mail.
* Any registered Iowa voter can request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You will need an Iowa ID to use Iowa's online voter registration system. If you do not have an Iowa ID, you can still register to vote by mail.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Iowa driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Iowa you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Iowa
  * be at least 17 years old (you must be 18 to vote)
  * not have been convicted of a felony (or have had your rights restored)
  * not currently be judged by a court to be “incompetent to vote”
  * not claim the right to vote in more than one place
